There isn't much more you can do in town right now. It's time to EMBARK on a quest!
Press {colour_start|notable}[TOUCH PAD BUTTON RIGHT]{colour_end} to embark!

There isn't much more you can do in town right now. It's time to EMBARK on a quest!
Press {colour_start|notable}[START]{colour_end}!

Each item, if you take it, will occupy space in your inventory.
Hold {colour_start|notable}[L2] and use [LEFT STICK]{colour_end} to show details about the items available to loot. This works in your inventory, too!
(Press {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[CIRCLE BUTTON]{colour_end} to close this window.)

Each item, if you take it, will occupy space in your inventory.
Hold {colour_start|notable}[L BUTTON] and use [LEFT STICK]{colour_end} to show details about the items available to loot. This works in your inventory, too!
(Press {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[CIRCLE BUTTON]{colour_end} to close this window.)

You'll want to take {colour_start|notable}different supplies{colour_end} depending on what {colour_start|notable}region{colour_end} you are going to, how {colour_start|notable}long{colour_end} the quest is, and your own preferences. But always bring some {colour_start|notable}food{colour_end} and {colour_start|notable}torches{colour_end}!
For your first short quest, try bringing at least 8 food and 4 torches.
To see details about any item, hold {colour_start|notable}[L2]{colour_end}. This works for inventory and loot windows, too!

You'll want to take {colour_start|notable}different supplies{colour_end} depending on what {colour_start|notable}region{colour_end} you are going to, how {colour_start|notable}long{colour_end} the quest is, and your own preferences.
For your first short quest, try bringing at least 8 food and 4 torches.
To see details about any item, hold {colour_start|notable}[L Button]{colour_end}. This works for inventory and loot windows, too!

This is where you select a quest and form an adventuring party of four heroes to embark on it.
{colour_start|notable}[CLICK]{colour_end} on quests to see their details.
{colour_start|notable}[DRAG]{colour_end} heroes into slots at the bottom of the screen to form your party and default party order.

This is where you select a quest and form an adventuring party of four heroes to embark on it.
{colour_start|notable}[SELECT]{colour_end} quests with {colour_start|notable}[LEFT STICK]{colour_end} to see their details.
Place heroes into slots at the bottom of the screen to form your party by holding{colour_start|notable}[R2]{colour_end} and using the {colour_start|notable}[CROSS BUTTON]{colour_end}.

This is where you select a quest and form an adventuring party of four heroes to embark on it.
Select quests with {colour_start|notable}[LEFT STICK]{colour_end} to see their details.
Place heroes into slots at the bottom of the screen to form your party by holding{colour_start|notable}[R]{colour_end} and using the {colour_start|notable}[CROSS BUTTON]{colour_end}.

You'll need to {colour_start|notable}recruit all of these heroes{colour_end} to fill out a party of four.
{colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[Drag and drop]{colour_end} them into your roster.

You'll need to {colour_start|notable}recruit all of these heroes{colour_end} to fill out a party of four.
Select each hero with {colour_start|notable}[LEFT STICK] plus [CROSS BUTTON]{colour_end} and then use {colour_start|notable}[LEFT STICK] plus [CROSS BUTTON]{colour_end} again to place the hero in your active roster on the right.

While you're here, spend some of your starting heirlooms on {colour_start|notable}upgrading the Stagecoach Network{colour_end}. This will increase the number of heroes available here in the future.
To upgrade, click the {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[+]{colour_end} symbol on the left, and then click the upgrade.

While you're here, spend some of your starting heirlooms on {colour_start|notable}upgrading the Stagecoach Network{colour_end}. This will increase the number of heroes available here in the future.
To upgrade, hold {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[L2]{colour_end} to access the upgrades menu and then use {colour_start|notable}[LEFT STICK] plus [X BUTTON]{colour_end} to purchase upgrades.

While you're here, spend some of your starting heirlooms on {colour_start|notable}upgrading the Stagecoach Network{colour_end}. This will increase the number of heroes available here in the future.
To upgrade, hold {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[L BUTTON]{colour_end} to access the upgrades menu and then use {colour_start|notable}[LEFT STICK] plus [X BUTTON]{colour_end} to purchase upgrades.

After you've completed the requirements of a quest, you have the option to {colour_start|notable}return to town{colour_end} at any time--just press {colour_start|notable}[TOUCH PAD BUTTON RIGHT]{colour_end}. You don't need to return to the starting room of the dungeon to exit.
(Press {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[CIRCLE BUTTON]{colour_end} to close this window.)

After you've completed the requirements of a quest, you have the option to {colour_start|notable}return to town{colour_end} at any time--just {colour_start|notable}[press START BUTTON]{colour_end}. You don't need to return to the starting room of the dungeon to exit.
(Press {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[CIRCLE BUTTON]{colour_end} to close this window.)

When a hero is selected, press {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[SQUARE BUTTON]{colour_end} to bring up a detailed panel showing all of the hero's {colour_start|notable}quirks{colour_end}, {colour_start|notable}skills{colour_end}, and {colour_start|notable}resistances{colour_end}.

On any screen in the game, press {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[TOUCH PAD BUTTON LEFT]{colour_end} to see contextual help.
Try it while in town, exploring, fighting, camping, and more.

On any screen in the game, press {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[SELECT BUTTON]{colour_end} and choose {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[HELP]{colour_end} to see contextual help.
Try it while in town, exploring, fighting, camping, and more.

Combat is {colour_start|notable}turn-based{colour_end}. On your hero's turn, {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[SELECT]{colour_end} a skill icon and then {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[SELECT]{colour_end} a target.
If you can't select a particular skill, it's because that hero needs to be {colour_start|notable}standing in a different spot{colour_end} or there are {colour_start|notable}no valid targets{colour_end}. {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[HIGHLIGHT]{colour_end} the skill to see the requirements.

You are currently in a {colour_start|notable}room{colour_end}.
To move towards another room, use {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[RIGHT STICK]{colour_end} to select a {colour_start|notable}destination room{colour_end} on the {colour_start|notable}map{colour_end}. This will take you to the {colour_start|notable}connecting hallway{colour_end}.
(Press {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[CIRCLE BUTTON]{colour_end} to close this window.)

You are currently in a {colour_start|notable}room{colour_end}.
To move towards another room, use {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[RIGHT STICK]{colour_end} to select a {colour_start|notable}destination room{colour_end} on the {colour_start|notable}map{colour_end}. This will take you to the {colour_start|notable}connecting hallway{colour_end}.

While in a {colour_start|notable}hallway{colour_end}, use {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[LEFT STICK]{colour_end} to move forward or backward.
(Press {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[CIRCLE BUTTON]{colour_end} to close this window.)

While exploring, you will often find {colour_start|notable}interactive objects{colour_end}. Press {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[CROSS BUTTON]{colour_end} to investigate them with the active hero. Take a look at this tent...
(Press {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[CIRCLE BUTTON]{colour_end} to close this window.)

Your hero is {colour_start|pop_text_bleed}bleeding{colour_end}!
If you wish, you can use a {colour_start|notable}bandage{colour_end} from inventory to stop the flow. Select the bandage and press {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[TRIANGLE BUTTON]{colour_end} to use it when it's the injured hero's turn.

Select and use Anti-Venom, Bandages, or Medicinal Herbs from inventory with {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[LEFT STICK]{colour_end} and {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[TRIANGLE BUTTON]{colour_end} to heal BLIGHT, BLEED, or DEBUFFS on the current hero, respectively.

The {colour_start|notable}light{colour_end} is fading! The current {colour_start|notable}torch level greatly affects many mechanics{colour_end} in the game. The darker it gets, the harder things get but the better the rewards. Select a torch in inventory and press {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[TRIANGLE BUTTON]{colour_end} to consume it and boost the light back up.

This quest involves {colour_start|notable}Camping{colour_end} and Camping requires {colour_start|notable}firewood{colour_end}. Firewood is {colour_start|notable}given automatically{colour_end} to you on appropriate quests.
{colour_start|notable}Camping{colour_end} gives heroes a chance to {colour_start|notable}recuperate while in the dungeon{colour_end}. When you are wounded or stressed and wish to camp, select firewood in your inventory and press {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[TRIANGLE BUTTON]{colour_end}.

Scouted {colour_start|trap}traps{colour_end} will be {colour_start|notable}visible on the ground{colour_end} as you approach them. Select a hero and then press {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[CROSS BUTTON]{colour_end} while near the {colour_start|trap}trap{colour_end} to attempt to {colour_start|notable}disarm it{colour_end}.
When heroes are within range of a scouted trap, the trap icon will show up in their status bars.
Some heroes are better than others at disarming.
To enter a {colour_start|notable}door{colour_end}, press {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[CROSS BUTTON]{colour_end} when standing in front of it.

Each hero has slots to equip two items, called {colour_start|notable}trinkets{colour_end}. Just select the trinket in inventory and press {colour_start|notable}[CROSS BUTTON] {colour_end} to equip it. {colour_start|notable}Trinkets{colour_end} generally have a trade-off: something good, something bad. Some are also restricted to one hero class.

You can sell back unwanted trinkets from your Trinket Inventory and make some money. Open the Trinket Inventory with {colour_start|notable}[TRIANGLE BUTTON]{colour_end}, select a trinket you don't want, and then sell it with [SQUARE BUTTON].

A critical scouting success will sometimes reveal a {colour_start|notable}Secret Room{colour_end}! Advance to the tile marked with a star, and press {colour_start|notable}[CROSS BUTTON]{colour_end} to enter. Fabulous wealth and riches await those equipped with a {colour_start|notable}key{colour_end}...

Select a hero with {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[R2 plus LEFT STICK]{colour_end} and then press {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[SQUARE BUTTON]{colour_end} to inspect their character sheet. Skills can be selected, clothing color can be changed, and they can be renamed or dismissed permanently.

Select a hero with {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[R Button plus LEFT STICK]{colour_end} and then press {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[SQUARE BUTTON]{colour_end} to inspect their character sheet. Skills can be selected, clothing color can be changed, and they can be renamed or dismissed permanently.
Use {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[LEFT STICK and CROSS BUTTON]{colour_end} to enter buildings.
BLACKSMITH, GUILD, SURVIVALIST: upgrade hero skills and equipment
TAVERN, ABBEY: send heroes for {colour_start|stressNOT1}stress{colour_end} relief
SANITARIUM: treat heroes' quirks and diseases
Press {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[TOUCH PAD BUTTON RIGHT]{colour_end} when ready to {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}EMBARK ON A QUEST{colour_end}.
Press {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[START BUTTON]{colour_end} when ready to {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}EMBARK ON A QUEST{colour_end}.
Hold {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[L2]{colour_end} to access upgrades for this building.
Hold {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[L Button]{colour_end} to access upgrades for this building.
With a hero selected, press {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[SQUARE BUTTON]{colour_end} to inspect them.
Use {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[CROSS BUTTON]{colour_end} to hire and place new heroes into your roster.
Hold {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[L2]{colour_end} to access upgrades for this building.
Hold {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[L Button]{colour_end} to access upgrades for this building.
{colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[Place]{colour_end} a hero from your roster into the Blacksmith slot to see their weapon and armor upgrade options.

{colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[Select]{colour_end} upgrades and press {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[CROSS BUTTON]{colour_end} to purchase them. You may need to upgrade the Blacksmith before purchasing certain hero upgrades.
Hold {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[L2]{colour_end} to access upgrades for this building.
Hold {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[L Button]{colour_end} to access upgrades for this building.
{colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[Place]{colour_end} a hero from your roster into the Guild to see their skill upgrade options.

{colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[Select]{colour_end} combat skills or combat skill upgrades and press {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[CROSS BUTTON]{colour_end} to purchase them. You may need to upgrade the Guild before purchasing certain hero upgrades.
Hold {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[L2]{colour_end} to access upgrades for this building.
Hold {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[L Button]{colour_end} to access upgrades for this building.
{colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[Place]{colour_end} a hero from your roster into the Survivalist to see their Camping skill upgrade options.

{colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[Select]{colour_end} skills or upgrades and press {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[CROSS BUTTON]{colour_end} to purchase them. You may need to upgrade the Survivalist before purchasing certain hero upgrades.
Hold {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[L2]{colour_end} to access upgrades for this building.
Hold {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[L Button]{colour_end} to access upgrades for this building.

{colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[Place]{colour_end} a hero from your roster into the appropriate slot and confirm payment with {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[CROSS BUTTON]{colour_end} to begin a stress-relieving activity.
Some quirks will block a hero from taking part in that activity.
Each activity has different costs, {colour_start|stressNOT1}stress{colour_end} relief values, and possible side-effects. You will have to discover some of them through play.
Committing the hero to the activity will make them unavailable for the next quest.
You will need to upgrade the building to unlock additional activity slots.

Select an unoccupied building slot and press {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[CROSS BUTTON]{colour_end} to eject the hero from the building activity prematurely. You will not be refunded the money spent.
Hold {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[L2]{colour_end} to access upgrades for this building.
Hold {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[L Button]{colour_end} to access upgrades for this building.

{colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[Place]{colour_end} a hero from your roster into the appropriate slot and confirm payment with {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[CROSS BUTTON]{colour_end} to begin a stress-relieving activity.
Some quirks will block a hero from taking part in that activity.
Each activity has different costs, {colour_start|stressNOT1}stress{colour_end} relief values, and possible side-effects. You will have to discover some of them through play.
Committing the hero to the activity will make them unavailable for the next quest.
You will need to upgrade the building to unlock additional activity slots.

Select an unoccupied building slot and press {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[CROSS BUTTON]{colour_end} to eject the hero from the building activity prematurely. You will not be refunded the money spent.
Hold {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[L2]{colour_end} to access upgrades for this building.
Hold {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[L Button]{colour_end} to access upgrades for this building.

Treating quirks: {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[Place]{colour_end} a hero into a treatment ward slot and select a positive quirk to reinforce and/or a negative quirk to remove. Severe quirks cost more to remove.
Treating diseases: {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[Place]{colour_end} a hero into a medical ward slot and select a disease to treat. Sometimes extra diseases will also be cured.
Committing the hero to treatment will make them unavailable for the next quest.
You will need to upgrade the building to unlock additional treatment slots.

Select an unoccupied building slot and press {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[CROSS BUTTON]{colour_end} to eject the hero from the building activity prematurely. You will not be refunded the money spent.
Hold {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[L2]{colour_end} to access upgrades for this building.
Hold {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[L Button]{colour_end} to access upgrades for this building.
{colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[Select]{colour_end} an available item and press {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[CROSS BUTTON]{colour_end} to purchase it.

{colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[Select]{colour_end} heroes and press {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[CROSS BUTTON]{colour_end} to add them into the adventuring party.
Heroes that are in the Tavern, Abbey, or Sanitarium will be unavailable for use.
Complete quests in regions to advance your Mastery in that region and open up new quest types.
Press {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[TOUCH PAD BUTTON RIGHT]{colour_end} when ready to proceed to Provisioning.
Press {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[START BUTTON]{colour_end} when ready to proceed to Provisioning.

{colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[Select]{colour_end} items in the shop and press {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[CROSS BUTTON]{colour_end} to purchase them for the expedition.
At quest end, unused provisions will be discarded without repayment. Buy only as much as you need!
You'll always want to carry some food and torches! Each hero generally eats 1 food unit per meal (Camping or Hunger event) and even on short quests you'll want at least 8 torches.
Use {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[RIGHT STICK]{colour_end} to choose a new room destination and enter the connecting hallway.
Use {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[R1 and L1]{colour_end} to change active hero.
Tap {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[REAR TOUCH PAD]{colour_end} to change active hero.
Use {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[UP BUTTON and DOWN BUTTON]{colour_end} to toggle between INVENTORY and MAP.

Press {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[CROSS BUTTON]{colour_end} to move a hero within the party. {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[Hold CROSS BUTTON]{colour_end} to restore default order.
Press {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[CROSS BUTTON]{colour_end} to move a hero within the party.
To start CAMPING, select firewood in inventory (if you have any) and press {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[TRIANGLE BUTTON]{colour_end}.
Hold {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[L2]{colour_end} to view gameplay effects like light level and hero status conditions.
Hold {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[L Button]{colour_end} to view gameplay info.
Press {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[TOUCH PAD BUTTON RIGHT]{colour_end} to abandon the quest and return to the Hamlet.
Press {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[START BUTTON]{colour_end} to abandon the quest and return to the Hamlet.
Hold {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[R Button]{colour_end} to access map controls.
Press {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[SQUARE BUTTON]{colour_end} to see a hero's detailed character sheet.
Use {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[RIGHT STICK]{colour_end} to walk forward or backward.
Use {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[UP BUTTON and DOWN BUTTON]{colour_end} to toggle between INVENTORY and MAP.
Use {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[R1 and L1]{colour_end} to change hero selection.
Tap {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[REAR TOUCH PAD]{colour_end} to change active hero.

Press {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[CROSS BUTTON]{colour_end} to move a hero within the party. {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[Hold CROSS BUTTON]{colour_end} to restore default order.
Press {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[CROSS BUTTON]{colour_end} to move a hero within the party.
Hold {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[L2]{colour_end} to view gameplay effects like light level and hero status conditions.
Hold {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[L Button]{colour_end} to view gameplay effects like light level and hero status conditions.
Hold {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[R Button]{colour_end} to access map controls.
Press {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[TOUCH PAD BUTTON RIGHT]{colour_end} to abandon the quest and return to the Hamlet.
Press {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[START BUTTON]{colour_end} to abandon the quest and return to the Hamlet.

On hero's turn, use {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[LEFT STICK]{colour_end} and {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[CROSS BUTTON]{colour_end} to select a valid combat skill and then a target.

Each skill has requirements for where the hero needs to be standing and what enemies they can target. Select a skill with {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[LEFT STICK]{colour_end} to see the requirements.

When selecting a target with {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[LEFT STICK]{colour_end}, you can see that enemy's stats and the hero's chance to hit / damage values with the currently selected skill.
Press {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[SQUARE BUTTON]{colour_end} to see a hero's detailed character sheet.
Hold {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[L2]{colour_end} to view current light level and hero / monster status effects.
Hold {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[L Button]{colour_end} to view gameplay effects like light level and hero status conditions.

Select and use Anti-Venom, Bandages, or Medicinal Herbs from inventory with {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[TRIANGLE BUTTON]{colour_end} to heal BLIGHT, BLEED, or DEBUFFS on the current hero, respectively.

Use {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[LEFT STICK]{colour_end} to highlight a meal option and press {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[CROSS BUTTON]{colour_end} to eat. You are limited by how much food you have in inventory.
Your party has {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[12 RESPITE POINTS]{colour_end} to spend on using Camping skills.

Use {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[L1 and R1]{colour_end} to select a hero and then {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[LEFT STICK and CROSS BUTTON]{colour_end} to use a skill. Some skills require a target to be selected.

Use {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[REAR TOUCH PAD]{colour_end} to select a hero and then {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[LEFT STICK and CROSS BUTTON]{colour_end} to use a skill. Some skills require a target to be selected.
When done spending RESPITE POINTS, press {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[TRIANGLE BUTTON]{colour_end} to finish camping.
Use {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[RIGHT STICK]{colour_end} to select a destination room on the map.
Hold [L2] and press [CIRCLE BUTTON] to reduce torchlight.
Hold [L2] and press [CIRCLE BUTTON] repeatedly to snuff out the torch.
Your save file appears to have been corrupted. Estate cannot be loaded.
Press [CROSS BUTTON] to dismiss hero word balloons.
[Hold TRIANGLE BUTTON] to discard an item.
[CROSS BUTTON] to commit hero for treatment.
Press {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[CROSS BUTTON]{colour_end} to recruit into roster.
[CROSS BUTTON] to commit hero for treatment.
Use {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[RIGHT STICK]{colour_end} to select a destination room on the map.
Hold [L BUTTON] and press [CIRCLE BUTTON] to reduce torchlight.
Hold [L BUTTON] and press [CIRCLE BUTTON] repeatedly to snuff out the torch.

Word of our predicament has spread, and a new crop of aspiring corpses step from the stagecoach...

Heroes gain {colour_start|notable}Resolve XP{colour_end} for each successful quest. {colour_start|notable}Resolve XP{colour_end} in turn determines the hero's {colour_start|notable}Resolve Level{colour_end}.
{colour_start|notable}Resolve Level{colour_end} represents the hero's veteranship, and directly acts as {colour_start|notable}Stress Resistance{colour_end} against the horrors encountered in the dungeons.
A low {colour_start|notable}Resolve Level{colour_end} hero that tries a higher level quest will quickly crumble under the unimaginable stresses.

When most monsters die, they leave corpses. Corpses act as temporary obstacles and will eventually go away on their own.
You can attack corpses to destroy them faster, but often a better approach is to use ranged skills, push/pull skills, and even corpse-clearing special skills that some heroes possess.
Monsters killed with bleed, blight, or crits leave no corpses at all!
Use Camping skills to help the heroes.
Deep within the shattered vaults of your ancestral home, a Necromancer is performing unspeakable rituals even raising the dead! It must be stopped.
A man tells of a beast so terrible that the swinefolk have made it their Lord. Perhaps it is only rumor and shadow, but this threat cannot be left to fester.
A man tells of a beast so terrible that the swinefolk have made it their Lord. Perhaps it is only rumor and shadow, but this threat cannot be left to fester.
A man tells of a beast so terrible that the swinefolk have made it their Lord. Perhaps it is only rumor and shadow, but this threat cannot be left to fester.
Raving madman, doom bearer, apocalyptic herald. Whatever his role, there is a sickness in his wild sermons that must be silenced. Dispose of this "Prophet."
Raving madman, doom bearer, apocalyptic herald. Whatever his role, there is a sickness in his wild sermons that must be silenced. Dispose of this "Prophet."
Raving madman, doom bearer, apocalyptic herald. Whatever his role, there is a sickness in his wild sermons that must be silenced. Dispose of this "Prophet."
Some things were never meant to live. Cleanse the sin of the Ancestor's experimentations and put this abomination into the abyss where it belongs.
Some things were never meant to live. Cleanse the sin of the Ancestor's experimentations and put this abomination into the abyss where it belongs.
Some things were never meant to live. Cleanse the sin of the Ancestor's experimentations and put this abomination into the abyss where it belongs.
The vengeful wraiths threaten to drag all we've built down into their domain of darkness. Give them a sailor's death - once and for all!
The vengeful wraiths threaten to drag all we've built down into their domain of darkness. Give them a sailor's death - once and for all!
The vengeful wraiths threaten to drag all we've built down into their domain of darkness. Give them a sailor's death - once and for all!
Test yourself in the mad realm of your fallen ancestor. Take note of how the creatures have taken over, but don't delve too far.
Is an apocalypse building? Cinch your packs and delve far, far into the tunnels of your fallen family. Make a map of your expedition.
The unholy abominations inhabiting the crumbling house have turned beacons of Light into vessels for diabolical worship. Cleanse these altars with Consecrated Essence.
Take the Old Road into the wood and then pick any of the dozens of dark paths. Test that path and then return with your heads intact.
The Weald was nearly inscrutable even before the corruption. Now it is nothing but mystery. Provision well and mount an expedition to map as much ground as you can.
Many a cart-driver has met their end while traversing the Weald. A king's ransom of medicines was recently lost. They would assist in rebuilding this sickly hamlet.
Blighted corpses lay strewn about the Old Road, teeming with disease. Journeys to and fro pose constant threat of sickness. Destroy this blight with Potent Salve.
The swine's appetite for comestibles exceeds even their thirst for blood. Winter is always close, and the Hamlet would do well to restock its sparse larder.
Your Ancestor was receiving eldritch relics via marine shipments. Find and return them to town where they can be stored safely out of the hands of greater evils.
With the stagecoach destroyed and the Caretaker gone, you will have to make the journey to the Hamlet on foot.

Darkest Dungeon is about making the most of a bad situation. Quests will fail or must be abandoned. Heroes will die. And when they die, they stay dead. Progress autosaves frequently, so actions are permanent.

While in dungeons, holding left trigger is required before you can swap hero positions, change hero selection, or view character sheets. Turn this on if you frequently start swapping a hero's position when you didn't intend to.

While in dungeons, holding L2 Button is required before you can swap hero positions, change hero selection, or view character sheets. Turn this on if you frequently start swapping a hero's position when you didn't intend to.

While in dungeons, holding L Button is required before you can swap hero positions, change hero selection, or view character sheets. Turn this on if you frequently start swapping a hero's position when you didn't intend to.
No Rear Touch Pad in Dungeon
While walking in dungeons, use Left and Right Buttons for hero swapping instead of Rear Touch Pad. Turn this option ON if you frequently accidentally tap the Rear Touch Pad while exploring.
Use Left and Right Buttons in Dungeon
While walking in dungeons, use Left and Right Buttons for hero swapping instead of L1 and L2 Buttons.
While in dungeons, pressing up on LEFT Stick can be used to enter doors, open curios, and similar actions. (This duplicates Cross Button functionality.)
Turning this off disables rear touch pad inputs and uses the front touchscreen instead for the same things. Do this if you find yourself accidentally tapping the rear touch pad.

Vous ne pouvez plus faire grand-chose en ville. Il est temps d'EMBARQUER pour une qute !
Appuyez sur {colour_start|notable}[LA TOUCHE DROITE DU PAV TACTILE]{colour_end} pour embarquer !

Vous ne pouvez plus faire grand-chose en ville. Il est temps d'EMBARQUER pour une qute !
Appuyez sur la {colour_start|notable}[TOUCHE START]{colour_end} !

Chaque objet emport prendra de la place dans l'inventaire. Maintenez {colour_start|notable}[L2] et utilisez le [JOYSTICK GAUCHE]{colour_end} pour voir les dtails des objets du butin. Cela fonctionne galement dans l'inventaire ! (Appuyez sur la {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[TOUCHE CERCLE]{colour_end} pour fermer cette fentre.)

Chaque objet emport prendra de la place dans l'inventaire.
Maintenez la {colour_start|notable}[TOUCHE L] et utilisez le [JOYSTICK GAUCHE]{colour_end} pour voir les dtails des objets du butin. Cela fonctionne galement dans l'inventaire !
(Appuyez sur la {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[TOUCHE CERCLE]{colour_end} pour fermer cette fentre.)

Il vous faudra emporter des {colour_start|notable}provisions diffrentes{colour_end} en fonction de la {colour_start|notable}rgion{colour_end} dans laquelle vous vous rendez, de la {colour_start|notable}longueur{colour_end} de la qute et de vos prfrences personnelles. Mais assurez-vous de toujours prendre de la {colour_start|notable}nourriture{colour_end} et des {colour_start|notable}torches{colour_end} !
Pour votre premire qute courte, essayez d'emporter au moins 8 units de nourriture et 4 torches.
Maintenez {colour_start|notable}[L2]{colour_end} pour voir les dtails des objets. Cela fonctionne galement dans l'inventaire et dans la fentre de butin !

Il vous faudra emporter des {colour_start|notable}provisions diffrentes{colour_end} en fonction de la {colour_start|notable}rgion{colour_end} dans laquelle vous vous rendez, de la {colour_start|notable}longueur{colour_end} de la qute et de vos prfrences personnelles.
Pour votre premire qute courte, essayez d'emporter au moins 8 units de nourriture et 4 torches.
Maintenez la {colour_start|notable}[touche L]{colour_end} pour voir les dtails des objets. Cela fonctionne galement dans l'inventaire et dans la fentre de butin !

Ici, vous slectionnez une qute et formez un groupe d'aventuriers compos de quatre hros. {colour_start|notable}[CLIQUEZ]{colour_end} sur une qute pour en voir les dtails. {colour_start|notable}[FAITES GLISSER]{colour_end} des hros dans les emplacements en bas de l'cran pour former votre groupe et dfinir son organisation par dfaut.

Ici, vous slectionnez une qute et formez un groupe d'aventuriers compos de quatre hros.
{colour_start|notable}[SLECTIONNEZ]{colour_end} les qutes avec le {colour_start|notable}[JOYSTICK GAUCHE]{colour_end} pour en voir les dtails.
Placez des hros dans les emplacements en bas de l'cran pour former votre groupe en maintenant {colour_start|notable}[R2]{colour_end} et en appuyant sur la {colour_start|notable}[TOUCHE CROIX]{colour_end}.

Ici, vous slectionnez une qute et formez un groupe d'aventuriers compos de quatre hros.
Slectionnez des qutes avec le {colour_start|notable}[JOYSTICK GAUCHE]{colour_end} pour en voir les dtails.
Placez des hros dans les emplacements en bas de l'cran pour former votre groupe en maintenant {colour_start|notable}[R]{colour_end} et en appuyant sur la {colour_start|notable}[TOUCHE CROIX]{colour_end}.

Vous devrez {colour_start|notable}recruter tous ces hros{colour_end} pour former un groupe de quatre.
{colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[Faites glisser et dposez]{colour_end} ces hros dans votre liste de recrues.

Vous devrez {colour_start|notable}recruter tous ces hros{colour_end} pour former un groupe de quatre.
Slectionnez chaque hros avec {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[JOYSTICK GAUCHE + TOUCHE CROIX]{colour_end} puis utilisez {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[JOYSTICK GAUCHE + TOUCHE CROIX]{colour_end} nouveau pour placer ces hros dans votre liste de recrues sur la droite.

Pendant que vous tes l, utilisez quelques-uns de vos premiers legs pour {colour_start|notable}amliorer le rseau de diligences{colour_end}. Cela augmentera le nombre de hros disponibles dans le futur.
Pour l'amliorer, cliquez sur le {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[+]{colour_end} sur la gauche, puis slectionnez l'amlioration.

Pendant que vous tes l, utilisez quelques-uns de vos premiers legs pour {colour_start|notable}amliorer le rseau de diligences{colour_end}. Cela augmentera le nombre de hros disponibles dans le futur.
Pour l'amliorer, maintenez {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[L2]{colour_end} pour accder au menu d'amlioration, puis utilisez {colour_start|notable}[JOYSTICK GAUCHE + TOUCHE CROIX]{colour_end} pour acheter des amliorations.

Pendant que vous tes l, utilisez quelques-uns de vos premiers legs pour {colour_start|notable}amliorer le rseau de diligences{colour_end}. Cela augmentera le nombre de hros disponibles dans le futur.
Pour l'amliorer, maintenez {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[L]{colour_end} pour accder au menu d'amlioration, puis utilisez {colour_start|notable}[JOYSTICK GAUCHE + TOUCHE CROIX]{colour_end} pour acheter des amliorations.

Aprs avoir accompli les objectifs d'une qute, vous avez l'option de {colour_start|notable}retourner en ville{colour_end} tout moment en appuyant sur la {colour_start|notable}[TOUCHE DROITE DU PAV TACTILE]{colour_end}. Il n'est pas ncessaire de revenir dans la premire pice du donjon pour en sortir.
(Appuyez sur la {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[TOUCHE CERCLE]{colour_end} pour fermer cette fentre.)

Aprs avoir accompli les objectifs d'une qute, vous avez l'option de {colour_start|notable}retourner en ville{colour_end} tout moment en {colour_start|notable}[appuyant sur la TOUCHE START]{colour_end}. Il n'est pas ncessaire de revenir dans la premire pice du donjon pour en sortir.
(Appuyez sur la {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[TOUCHE CERCLE]{colour_end} pour fermer cette fentre.)

Lorsqu'un hros est slectionn, appuyez sur la {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[TOUCHE CARR]{colour_end} pour afficher un panneau dtaill indiquant tous ses {colour_start|notable}attributs{colour_end}, {colour_start|notable}comptences{colour_end} et {colour_start|notable}rsistances{colour_end}.

Sur n'importe quel cran du jeu, appuyez sur la {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[TOUCHE GAUCHE DU PAV TACTILE]{colour_end} pour afficher l'aide contextuelle.
Testez cela en ville, en exploration, en combat, en campement et plus encore.

Sur n'importe quel cran du jeu, appuyez sur la {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[TOUCHE SELECT]{colour_end} et slectionnez {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[AIDE]{colour_end} pour afficher une aide contextuelle.
Testez cela en ville, en exploration, en combat, en campement et plus encore.

Le combat se droule {colour_start|notable}au tour par tour{colour_end}. Lors du tour d'un hros, {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[SLECTIONNEZ]{colour_end} une icne de comptence puis {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[SLECTIONNEZ]{colour_end} une cible.
Si une comptence ne peut pas tre slectionne, cela signifie que ce hros doit {colour_start|notable}se trouver dans un emplacement diffrent{colour_end} ou qu'il n'existe {colour_start|notable}aucune cible valide{colour_end}. Mettez la comptence {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[en surbrillance]{colour_end} pour voir ses exigences.

Vous tes actuellement dans une {colour_start|notable}pice{colour_end}.
Pour vous dplacer vers une autre pice, utilisez le {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[JOYSTICK DROIT]{colour_end} pour slectionner une {colour_start|notable}destination{colour_end} sur la {colour_start|notable}carte{colour_end}. Cela vous fera passer par un {colour_start|notable}couloir{colour_end}.
(Appuyez sur la {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[TOUCHE CERCLE]{colour_end} pour fermer cette fentre.)

Vous tes actuellement dans une {colour_start|notable}pice{colour_end}.
Pour vous dplacer vers une autre pice, utilisez le {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[JOYSTICK DROIT]{colour_end} pour slectionner une {colour_start|notable}destination{colour_end} sur la {colour_start|notable}carte{colour_end}. Cela vous fera passer par un {colour_start|notable}couloir{colour_end}.

Dans un {colour_start|notable}couloir{colour_end}, utilisez le {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[JOYSTICK GAUCHE]{colour_end} pour avancer ou reculer.
(Appuyez sur la {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[TOUCHE CERCLE]{colour_end} pour fermer cette fentre.)

Vous trouverez souvent des {colour_start|notable}objets intractifs{colour_end} lors de votre exploration. Appuyez sur la {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[TOUCHE CROIX]{colour_end} pour les examiner avec le hros actif. Jetez un il sur cette tente...
(Appuyez sur la {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[TOUCHE CERCLE]{colour_end} pour fermer cette fentre.)

Votre hros {colour_start|pop_text_bleed}saigne{colour_end} !
Si vous le dsirez, vous pouvez utiliser un {colour_start|notable}bandage{colour_end} depuis l'inventaire pour arrter le saignement. Slectionnez le bandage puis appuyez sur la {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[TOUCHE TRIANGLE]{colour_end} lors du tour du hros bless pour l'utiliser.

Slectionnez et utilisez des antidotes, bandages ou herbes mdicinales depuis l'inventaire l'aide du {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[JOYSTICK GAUCHE]{colour_end} et de la {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[TOUCHE TRIANGLE]{colour_end} pour soigner les INFECTIONS, SAIGNEMENTS ou MALUS du hros actuel.

La {colour_start|notable}lumire{colour_end} se meurt ! Le {colour_start|notable}niveau de torche a un effet notable sur de nombreux mcanismes{colour_end} du jeu. Plus il fait sombre, plus la difficult augmente, mais meilleures sont les rcompenses. Slectionnez une torche dans l'inventaire puis appuyez sur la {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[TOUCHE TRIANGLE]{colour_end} pour l'utiliser et raviver la lumire.

Cette qute inclut un {colour_start|notable}campement{colour_end}, ce qui ncessite du {colour_start|notable}bois{colour_end}. Le bois est {colour_start|notable}fourni automatiquement{colour_end} pour les qutes concernes.
{colour_start|notable}Camper{colour_end} permet aux hros de {colour_start|notable}se rtablir lors de l'exploration du donjon{colour_end}. Si vous souffrez de blessures ou de stress et dsirez camper, slectionnez le bois dans votre inventaire puis appuyez sur la {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[TOUCHE TRIANGLE]{colour_end}.

Les {colour_start|trap}piges{colour_end} reprs l'avance sont {colour_start|notable}visibles au sol{colour_end} lorsque vous les approchez. Slectionnez un hros puis appuyez sur la {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[TOUCHE CROIX]{colour_end} proximit du {colour_start|harmful}pige{colour_end} pour essayer de {colour_start|notable}le dsarmer{colour_end}.
L'icne de pige apparait dans la barre de statut des hros lorsqu'un pige repr est porte.
Certains hros sont plus aptes que d'autres dsarmer les piges.
Pour ouvrir une {colour_start|notable}porte{colour_end}, tenez-vous devant celle-ci puis appuyez sur la {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[TOUCHE CROIX]{colour_end}.

Chaque hros dispose de deux emplacements destins quiper des objets nomms {colour_start|notable}breloques{colour_end}. Slectionnez simplement la breloque dans l'inventaire puis appuyez sur la {colour_start|notable}[TOUCHE CROIX]{colour_end} pour l'quiper. Les {colour_start|notable}breloques{colour_end} prsentent gnralement un compromis : un avantage pour un inconvnient. Certaines sont galement rserves une classe de hros prcise.

Vous pouvez gagner de l'argent en vendant vos breloques inutiles directement depuis l'inventaire de breloques. Ouvrez l'inventaire de breloques avec la {colour_start|notable}[TOUCHE TRIANGLE]{colour_end}, slectionnez une breloque dont vous ne voulez pas, puis vendez-la avec la {colour_start|notable}[TOUCHE CARR]{colour_end}.

Un succs critique en reprage rvlera parfois une {colour_start|notable}pice secrte{colour_end} ! Avancez jusqu' la case marque d'une toile et appuyez sur la {colour_start|notable}[TOUCHE CROIX]{colour_end} pour entrer. Ceux qui disposent d'une {colour_start|notable}cl{colour_end} pourront y trouver d'incroyables richesses...

Slectionnez un hros avec {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[R2 + JOYSTICK GAUCHE]{colour_end} puis appuyez sur la {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[TOUCHE CARR]{colour_end} pour inspecter sa fiche de personnage. Vous pouvez y slectionner des comptences, changer les couleurs des habits ou encore renommer ou renvoyer le hros.

Slectionnez un hros avec {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[TOUCHE R + JOYSTICK GAUCHE]{colour_end} puis appuyez sur la {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[TOUCHE CARR]{colour_end} pour inspecter sa fiche de personnage. Vous pouvez y slectionner des comptences, changer les couleurs des habits ou encore renommer ou renvoyer le hros.
Utilisez le {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[JOYSTICK GAUCHE et la TOUCHE CROIX]{colour_end} pour entrer dans un btiment.
DILIGENCE : permet de recruter de nouveaux hros
FORGE, GUILDE, EXPERTE EN SURVIE : permet d'amliorer les comptences et l'quipement des hros
TAVERNE, ABBAYE : permet de diminuer le {colour_start|stressNOT1}stress{colour_end} des hros
SANATORIUM : permet de traiter les maladies et attributs des hros
ROULOTTE : permet d'acheter des objets rares

Appuyez sur la {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[TOUCHE DROITE DU PAV TACTILE]{colour_end} si vous dsirez {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}EMBARQUER POUR UNE QUTE{colour_end}.

Utilisez la {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[TOUCHE CROIX]{colour_end} pour recruter des hros et les ajouter votre liste de recrues.
Maintenez {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[L2]{colour_end} pour voir les options d'amlioration de ce btiment.
Maintenez la {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[TOUCHE L]{colour_end} pour accder aux amliorations de ce btiment.

{colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[Slectionnez]{colour_end} des amliorations puis appuyez sur la {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[TOUCHE CROIX]{colour_end} pour les acheter. Il sera ncessaire d'amliorer la forge avant de pouvoir acheter certaines amliorations pour vos hros.
Maintenez {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[L2]{colour_end} pour voir les options d'amlioration de ce btiment.
Maintenez la {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[TOUCHE L]{colour_end} pour accder aux amliorations de ce btiment.
{colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[Placez]{colour_end} l'une de vos recrues dans la guilde pour voir les options d'amlioration de ses comptences.

{colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[Slectionnez]{colour_end} des comptences de combat ou des amliorations de comptences puis appuyez sur la {colour_start|town_activity_log_positive_result}[TOUCHE CROIX]{colour_end} pour les acheter. Il sera ncessaire d'amliorer la guilde avant de pouvoir acheter certaines amliorations pour vos hros.

Dans Darkest Dungeon, vous vous battez contre plus fort que vous. Des qutes choueront ou devront tre abandonnes. Des hros mourront et resteront morts. La progression est sauvegarde automatiquement. Chaque action est dfinitive.

Dans un donjon, maintenir la gchette gauche est ncessaire avant de pouvoir changer vos hros de position, modifier un hros slectionn ou consulter une feuille de personnage. Activez ceci si vous changez frquemment le positionnement d'un hros sans le vouloir.
